title: Installation issue: hub
body:
* more recent versions of the GitHub
hub library require the env['GOPATH']
line to be removed in the package.py
for the install to proceed with spack;
probably a go expert should take a look
because go modules can be tricky & that's
perhaps not the correct fix

* it seems the basic issue is that `go.mod`
ends up in the root of `GOPATH`, which is
apparently bad

* reproduce with: `spack install hub@2.14.1 %clang@11.0.0-apple`

```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/hub/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/hub/package.py
index 7b342b234..64ca3dedf 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/hub/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/hub/package.py
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@ class Hub(Package):
 
     def install(self, spec, prefix):
         env = os.environ
-        env['GOPATH'] = self.stage.source_path + ':' + env['GOPATH']
+        #env['GOPATH'] = self.stage.source_path + ':' + env['GOPATH']
         bash = which('bash')
         bash(os.path.join('script', 'build'), '-o', os.path.join(prefix, 'bin',
                                                                  'hub'))
```
